result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine E Glaser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Christine E Glaser appeared with Attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Attorney Angeline E Winton appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  No additions or corrections to the PSI.  State speaks to the court re: sentencing.  Atty Mangelsen speaks to the court re: sentencing.  Ms. Glaser speaks to the court.  Court speaks to the Ms. Glaser.  Court sentences the def. 

Sentencing--  3 years probation + costs   30 days jail-Huber

Restitution open for 60 Days   Any and all other condtions the DOC imposes.  Curfew 9pm-6am.
